Research Shows Centralized Exchanges Saw the Most Visits This Year From Americans, Koreans, Russians
entry.summary:
Residents of the United States, South Korea and the Russian Federation have been the most frequent users of centralized exchanges this year, according to a new study. The finding comes after the spectacular crash of FTX, one of the largest such platforms, amid tightening regulations and fewer new users.
U.S. Leads by Number of CEX Users, Turkey and Japan Are Also in the Top in Terms of Traffic
The U.S., South Korea and Russia together account for 22% of all visits to centralized exchanges (CEX) for cryptocurrencies, according to the 2022-2023 ‚ÄúGlobal Crypto Industry Overview and Trends‚Äù annual report produced by Huobi Research. The estimate is based on data from the top 100 CEXs on active users, trading depth, trading volume, and reliability.
With a share exceeding 9%, the United St‚Ä¶

Meanwhile, more athlete-led NFT projects continue to unfold, and there‚Äôs another non-traditional sports sponsorship deal coming to the market.
Let‚Äôs dive into the top stories across sports and crypto over the past week.
The Sports Slice
Orange Comet Pairs With Ex-NBA Star Scottie Pippen Six-time NBA champion Scottie Pippen is the latest former pro to launch an NFT collection. In a tweet announcement shared from Pippen last week, he launched a new partnership with NFT platform Orange Comet and his first ‚ÄúNFT sneaker collection.‚Äù
The two will launch their first collaborative drop, dubbed the ‚ÄòSP33 Collecti‚Ä¶

Angel investor Balaji Srinivasan says the collapse of crypto exchange FTX should be treated as ‚Äúa preview of state failure.‚Äù He warned that one day U.S. dollar bank accounts ‚Äúmay be frozen or inflated to worthlessness,‚Äù emphasizing that the authorities ‚Äúwill show no interest in prosecuting.‚Äù Srinivasan cautioned: ‚ÄúThat world is coming and we need alternatives.‚Äù
Balaji Srinivasan on FTX, State Failure, and U.S. Dollars Becoming Worthless
Angel investor Balaji Srinivasan commented on the collapse of crypto exchange FTX in a series of tweets Saturday. Formerly the CTO of crypto exchange Coinbase and a general partner at venture capital firm Andreessen Horowitz (a16z), Srinivasan is also the author of The Network State, a WSJ bestseller.

Simmons is an Israeli-born American musician, singer, songwriter, actor, and producer. entry.title: Hacker Steals $6.9 Million From Arbitrum-Based Defi Protocol Lodestar Finance
entry.summary:
Arbitrum-based lending platform Lodestar Finance was exploited on Dec. 10, 2022, according to a tweet from the project‚Äôs Twitter account on Saturday. Community reports detail that Lodestar lost roughly $6.9 million from the vulnerability.
Lodestar Finance Loses $6.9 Million in an Exploit, TVL Drained, LODE Drops by 53%
Another decentralized finance (defi) platform, Lodestar Finance was hacked for $6.9 million in an exploit, a number of reports detail. ‚Äú[The] protocol was exploited and deposits have been drained,‚Äù Lodestar‚Äôs official Twitter account said. ‚ÄúWe have set all interest rates to 0 so that supply and borrow balances are not moving while we weigh recovery options.‚Äù
Lodestar says the hacker ‚Äúmanipulated the exchange rate of the plvGLP contract‚Äù and then ‚Äúsupplied plvGLP collateral to Lodestar and borrowed all available liquidity.‚Äù This allowed the exploiter to cash out ‚Äúwhat they could.‚Äù However, a ‚Äúcollateralization ratio mechanism prevented them from fully cashing out the plvGLP,‚Äù the team noted on Saturday.
Via the team Discord channel, Lodestar team members explained that they had paused borrowing and liquidation activity. Data from defillama.com indicates that the total value locked (TVL) in Lodestar was drained from close to $7 million down to a mere $11.06. The project‚Äôs native cryptocurrency lodestar (LODE) has dropped 53% in value against the U.S. dollar in the last 24 hours.
LODE recently tapped an all-time high at $0.718 per unit, 18 days ago on Nov. 23, 2022. LODE‚Äôs value is now down 76.1% from that value and has seen a 24-hour price range of around $0.13 to $0.369 per unit. At press time, LODE is exchanging hands for $0.173 per coin.
What do you think about the Lodestar Finance hack on Saturday? Let us know what you think about this subject in the comments section below.

Binance CEO Allegedly Told SBF to Stop Causing ‚ÄòMore Damage‚Äô and to ‚ÄòStop Trying to Depeg Stablecoins‚Äô
The Wall Street Journal (WSJ) reports that just before the crypto exchange FTX filed for bankruptcy, there was a conversation between CZ and SBF on Nov. 10, 2022, in a Signal chat group called ‚ÄúExchange coordination.‚Äù The Signal group‚Äôs chat logs were apparently seen by the WS‚Ä¶

entry.title: How Dozens Of Denver Middle Schoolers Became Bitcoin Entrepreneurs
entry.summary: An entrepreneurship program for middle schoolers in Denver equipped participants with sats and lessons in what makes Bitcoin the future. This is an opinion editorial by Ryan Brisch, Anthony Feliciano and Mark Maraia, who recently spent a few weeks helping 85 middle schoolers operate a pop-up shop running on Bitcoin's Lightning Network. On November 18, 2022, about 85 students braved a cold snowy Friday morning at STRIVE Prep ‚Äì Lake middle school in Denver, Colorado to participate in a unique program. Even though they got a late start because of snowfall the night before, there was a sense of eager anticipation in the air. Ryan Brisch, a Denver Bitcoiner, had been frequently talking to his significant other about issues Bitcoin could help solve, or some new Bitcoin product that he was excite‚Ä¶

entry.title: New York Times, FT, Bloomberg Blasted for Attempting to Get FTX Creditors‚Äô Names Unsealed
entry.summary:
Amid the ongoing FTX bankruptcy proceedings, court documents indicate that media firms such as Bloomberg, the New York Times (NYT), Dow Jones & Company, and the Financial Times (FT) want the redacted information tied to FTX creditors unsealed. The media companies believe the public should be made aware of the creditors‚Äô information, as the publications stressed in the court filing that the ‚Äúnews media acts as the eyes and ears of the public.‚Äù
So-Called ‚ÄòMedia Intervenors‚Äô Insist the Court Should Unseal FTX‚Äôs Creditor Information
Four major news media publications have filed a document with the Chapter 11 bankruptcy case tied to the now-defunct FTX cryptocurrency exchange. Essentially, the publications call themselves ‚Äúmedia intervenors‚Äù and the intervenors ‚Äúobject to the continued seal‚Ä¶

entry.title: Another Member of Russian Crypto Pyramid Finiko Arrested in UAE
entry.summary:
Law enforcement authorities in the United Arab Emirates have detained a top Finiko representative, sought for his role in the crypto Ponzi scheme which defrauded thousands of investors around the world. This is the second arrest in the Gulf state of a high-ranking member of the pyramid announced in the past month.
Finiko Fraudster Caught by Interpol in UAE, Russia Seeks His Extradition
Another individual involved in organizing Russia‚Äôs largest financial pyramid in recent years, Finiko, has been placed under custody in the UAE. The detention of Edward Sabirov in the Arab country comes after last month‚Äôs news of the arrest of the Ponzi scheme‚Äôs co-founder, Zygmunt Zygmuntovich. Both have allegedly played key roles in the embezzlement of millions from the fraud‚Äôs victims.

entry.title: Astar Network CEO: Webassembly Smart Contracts Are Going to ‚ÄòPull a Lot of Talent From Web2 to Web3‚Äô
entry.summary:
Ethereum is almost universally credited for kickstarting the Web3 revolution after it brought to life the concept of smart contracts. However, some in the Web3 community, like Astar Network‚Äôs Sota Watanabe, believe the protocol cannot ‚Äúbuild the innovative future of blockchain alone.‚Äù In addition, some critics point to the language obstacle which they argue makes the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) a less-than-ideal place to build.
Webassembly Smart Contracts ‚ÄòWill Accelerate the Adoption of Web3‚Äô
It is this and other limitations of the EVM that led to the creation of an alternative known as Webassembly (WASM). This alternative is said to be a virtual machine of choice for developers, engineers and academics that are frustrated with the EVM. According to Watanabe, for Web2 developers th‚Ä¶

entry.title: Full Ban on Crypto in Russia Would Be Counterproductive, Rosfinmonitoring Says
entry.summary:
Russian citizens and businesses already own cryptocurrencies, which is why a complete crypto ban would be counterproductive, according to a top executive of Rosfinmonitoring, Russia‚Äôs financial intelligence agency. At the same time, the regulator supports prohibiting payments with digital coins and their advertising.
Rosfinmonitoring Backs Government‚Äôs Strategy to Strictly Regulate Cryptocurrencies in Russia
The Federal Financial Monitoring Service of the Russian Federation (Rosfinmonitoring) supports the adoption of strict rules for cryptocurrencies, as per the regulatory concept approved by the government, the agency‚Äôs Deputy Director Herman Neglyad said in an interview with Izvestia. However, the official also indicated to the Russian daily that a full ban is unlikely, elaborating: ‚Ä¶

Crypto Lawsuit Against Kim Kardashian Dismissed
A federal judge dismissed a proposed class action lawsuit on Wednesday against Ethereummax‚Äôs founders and the crypto project‚Äôs celebrity endorsers, including reality TV star Kim Kardashian, boxer Floyd Mayweather Jr., and former Boston Celtics star Paul Pierce.
In his ruling, Judge Michael Fitzgerald of the U.S. District Court for the Central District of California agreed that the lawsuit‚Äôs claims raised legitimate concerns about ‚Äúcelebrities‚Äô ability to readily persuade milli‚Ä¶

entry.title: How Bitcoin Can Enrich Our Interior Lives
entry.summary: Bitcoin can facilitate positive freedom by enabling individuals to retain value of their savings and feel more fulfilled. This is an opinion editorial by Logan Bolinger, a lawyer and the author of a free weekly newsletter about the intersection of Bitcoin, macroeconomics, geopolitics and law. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm more interested in asking the question, is the world that we want to live in one where we need to hyperfinancialize every aspect of an individual‚Äôs life because financial conditions on a macro level are such that you have to financialize your whole being in order to keep up or get ahead? Is that truly a victory for democracy and for the kind of psycho-spiritual wellbeing of all of us and the lives we want to live? Versus something like Bitcoin, that‚Äôs a definancializing force that basically says ‚Ä¶

entry.summary:
Billionaire Elon Musk, the CEO of Tesla and Spacex, has warned that the recession will be ‚Äúgreatly amplified‚Äù if the Federal Reserve raises interest rates again next week. He added that things will ‚Äúprobably start looking better‚Äù in the second quarter of 2024.
Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Recession and Fed‚Äôs Rate Hikes
Tesla CEO and Twitter chief Elon Musk has reiterated his warning about a recession in the U.S. He tweeted Friday that if the Federal Reserve raises interest rates again next week, the ‚Äúrecession will be greatly amplified.‚Äù
Musk was further asked on Twitter how long he thinks the recession will last. The Tesla boss replied:
Just a rough guess, but things probably start looking better in Q2 2024.
This was not the first time Musk warned about the consequences of the Fed‚Ä¶

entry.title: Robert Kiyosaki Expects Bitcoin Investors to Get Richer When Fed Pivots, Prints Trillions of Dollars
entry.summary:
The famous author of the best-selling book Rich Dad Poor Dad, Robert Kiyosaki, says that bitcoin investors will get richer when the Federal Reserve, the Treasury, and Wall Street pivot and trillions of dollars are printed.
Robert Kiyosaki Predicts Bitcoin Investors Will Get Richer
The author of Rich Dad Poor Dad, Robert Kiyosaki, has predicted that owners of bitcoin will get richer while ‚Äúfake money savers‚Äù will be the biggest losers.
Rich Dad Poor Dad is a 1997 book co-authored by Kiyosaki and Sharon Lechter. It has been on the New York Times Best Seller List for over six years. More than 32 million copies of the book have been sold in over 51 languages across more than 109 countries.
Kiyosaki tweeted Thursday that people who own gold, silver, and bitcoin will get richer when the ‚Ä¶

entry.title: FTX Gets A 3-Month Grace To Quit All Operations In Japan
entry.summary:
Some jurisdictions have been taking management and investigatory actions following the collapse of the FTX crypto exchange. Before its fall, the SBF-led crypto exchange got several operational approvals in many countries. Its expanded active regions accounted for its large customer base in the industry.
However, the sudden collapse of the exchanges led to the closedown of almost all its branches in many countries. However, the Japanese local regulatory authorities approved the FTX subsidiary in the country to continue some operations. In addition, they permitted the crypto exchange firm to tidy up its withdrawal issues.
FTX Japan Operations Extended by Three Months
A report revealed that the Kanto Local Finance Bureau is handling the approval. Furthermore, it noted that the local f‚Ä¶

entry.title: Pplpleasr‚Äôs Shibuya NFT Video Platform Raises $6.9M to Build the 'A24 of Web3'
entry.summary: Shibuya, which lets NFT owners interact with its original content, raised a seed round co-led by Andreessen Horowitz and Variant Fund.

entry.title: EU to 'Level Playing Field' for Crypto Firms With Uniform Tax Rules
entry.summary: A new directive aims to even up tax reporting in the EU for crypto operators, but some say the new requirements will burden many firms.

entry.title: Kim Kardashian, Floyd Mayweather EthereumMax Lawsuit Dismissed
entry.summary: A judge in California has dismissed a lawsuit against Kim Kardashian and others for promoting crypto project EthereumMax.

entry.title: Bankruptcy Judge Orders Celsius to Return $44M in Cryptocurrencies
entry.summary: It will only impact Celsius users who stored their funds in custody accounts rather than the firm's interest-bearing Earn program.

entry.title: Nexo Token Up 5% on Ethereum 'Smart Staking' Launch
entry.summary: The price surge comes on the heels of news that Nexo's Earn Interest Product has been suspended in eight U.S. states.

entry.title: Coinbase Revenue Will Be ‚ÄòHalf or Less‚Äô of Last Year‚Äôs: CEO Brian Armstrong
entry.summary: The Coinbase CEO was less than optimistic about the crypto exchange's financials for 2022, citing the ongoing bear market and FTX's collapse.

entry.title: NYC Prosecutors Probing Sam Bankman-Fried's Role in TerraUSD Collapse: Report
entry.summary: The Terra and Luna crash in May ultimately upended the entire crypto ecosystem‚Äîincluding SBF's failed exchange FTX.

entry.title: Congressional Subpoena for SBF 'Definitely on the Table', Says Rep. Maxine Waters
entry.summary: After taking a harsher tone on Twitter, the Democratic leader left open the possibility of forcing the FTX founder to testify about the company's collapse.

entry.title: Life After FTX: How Solana DeFi Is Starting Over‚ÄîWithout SBF‚Äôs Serum
entry.summary: Solana devs look to rebuild as they unwind DeFi on the network from Sam Bankman-Fried‚Äôs Serum, replace it with OpenBook, and plot a course for the future.

entry.title: Author Tim Ferriss Tops NFT Sales Charts With 'Cockpunch'
entry.summary: "The Legend of Cockpunch" is a fiction project from Ferriss, with all primary sale proceeds going to his charitable foundation.

entry.title: Congressman Calls for Investigation Into Gensler, SEC‚Äôs Role in FTX Collapse
entry.summary: Rep. Ritchie Torres (D-NY) accused Gensler of being ‚Äúsingularly responsible‚Äù for failing to prevent FTX‚Äôs demise.

entry.title: Blockparty Co-Founder Stole $1 Million in Bitcoin and Cash From Company, FBI Alleges
entry.summary: The ex-CTO of the NFT ticketing platform and marketplace allegedly spent the money on luxury items and travel.

entry.title: A DAO Is Trying to Buy the US Constitution‚ÄîAgain
entry.summary: It‚Äôs history repeating itself.

entry.title: Why Is Crypto Twitter Obsessed with ChatGPT?
entry.summary: The new artificial intelligence tool has gone viral, with some elevating it above the blockchain as the next big thing in tech.

entry.title: Independent Audit Confirms Binance‚Äôs Bitcoin Is More Than Fully Backed
entry.summary: The fall of FTX has increased scrutiny of the verifiable assets held by crypto exchanges.

entry.title: Bitcoin, Ethereum, Dogecoin Dip Along With Stocks as Recession Concerns Loom
entry.summary: Bitcoin dropped again today‚Äîtaking other cryptocurrencies with it‚Äîas traders continue to sell risk assets.

entry.title: The Crypties Awards 2022: Bored Ape Yacht Club Wins NFT Project of the Year
entry.summary: Illa Da Producer accepted the Cryptie on behalf of Yuga Labs from presenter Alanna Roazzi-Laforet at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Moonbirds, Azuki, DeGods, and CloneX.

entry.title: The Crypties 2022: Art Blocks Founder Wins Industry Achievement Award
entry.summary: Art Blocks founder Erick Calderon accepted the industry achievement award from presenter Clara Tsao of Filecoin Foundation at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30.

entry.title: The Crypties 2022: BFF Wins Diversity Award
entry.summary: Rachel Weiss and Jackie Courtney accepted the Cryptie for BFF from presenter Rebecca Barkin of Lamina1 at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were WomenRise, Boys Club, and The Hug.

entry.title: The Crypties Awards 2022: Crypto Unicorns Wins Game of the Year
entry.summary: Katrina Wolfe accepted the Cryptie for Crypto Unicorns from presenter Avery Akkineni of Vayner3 at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Stepn, Zed Run, and Blankos Block Party.

entry.title: The Crypties 2022: Celo Wins Social Impact Award
entry.summary: Marek Olszewski accepted the Cryptie for Celo from presenter Dan Roberts of Decrypt Media at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Ukraine DAO, Dream DAO, Proof of Protest, and Digital Diaspora.

entry.title: The Crypties 2022: Doodles Collab With Shopify Wins Mainstream Award
entry.summary: Shirley Cedeno and Akbar Hamid accepted the Cryptie on behalf of Doodles from presenters Igor Lilic and Gabriela Ramos Lilic of Breakout at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were RTFKT and Nike, Gmoney and Adidas, Tiffany and CryptoPunks, and TIMEpieces.

entry.title: The Crypties Awards 2022: People of Crypto Wins Metaverse Event of the Year
entry.summary: Simone Berry and Akbar Hamid accepted the Cryptie for People of Crypto's Metaverse Pride Parade from presenter Toni Thai Sterrett of Bad Grrls Creative Club at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Decentraland's Metaverse Fashion Week and Heal from The Sandbox and Code Green.

entry.title: The Crypties Awards 2022: Lens Protocol Wins DeFi Project of the Year
entry.summary: Bradley Freeman and Christina Beltramini accepted the Cryptie for Lens Protocol from presenter Jordan Garbis of BeetsDAO at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Aave, dYdX, and OlympusDAO.

entry.title: The Crypties Awards 2022: Coinbase Ventures Wins Investor of the Year
entry.summary: Shan Aggarwal accepted the Cryptie for Coinbase Ventures from presenter Amanda Cassatt of Serotonin at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Paradigm, a16z, and Polychain.

entry.title: Blocknative CEO Matt Cutler at 0xpo Crossroads
entry.summary: Blocknative's Matt Cutler sat down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at 0xpo Crossroads in San Francisco on November 3 to tell his Web3 origin story and Blocknative's business‚Äîplus misconceptions in the crypto space.

entry.title: Fintech Lawyer: Crypto Companies Need to Seek Legal Advice Before Launch
entry.summary: Lisa Rubin, a blockchain attorney with Paul Hastings, sat down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at 0xpo Crossroads in San Francisco on November 3 to discuss legal misconceptions the industry still holds.

entry.title: Phantom Co-Founder Francesco Agosti at 0xpo Crossroads
entry.summary: One of the minds behind the popular Solana dapp sits down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at 0xpo Crossroads in San Francisco on November 3 to discuss the history of Phantom and what he‚Äôs looking forward to in Web3.

entry.title: NFT Storytelling: Jason Michael Primrose, Amanda Terry, Artemysia-X, Kas Vegas at Camp Decrypt 2022
entry.summary: "Lost Children of Andromeda" author Jason Michael Primrose, Amanda Terry of Metagood and ACTAI Ventures, Artemysia-X of Rug Radio program LorePlay, and Kas Vegas of NFT INT, Huxley, and Feature.io all discussed how their work utilizes NFTs for storytelling, on a lively panel at Camp Decrypt moderated by What's Trending podcast host Shira Lazar.

entry.title: Edward Snowden Talks Tornado Cash Sanctions, Ethereum Merge, DAOs and NFTs at Camp Decrypt 2022
entry.summary: In an extensive talk with Decrypt's Dan Roberts at Camp Decrypt in Napa CA in October, Edward Snowden gave his candid views on the Ethereum merge, the sanctioning of Ethereum mixer Tornado Cash by the U.S. government, the privacy shortcomings of Bitcoin and Ethereum, and his view on using DAOs to source tips from whistleblowers.

entry.title: The New Landscape for NFT Drops: Bad Grrls Creative Club, BeetsDAO, and Cymbal at Camp Decrypt 2022
entry.summary: Amid a crypto bear market and recent declines in NFT sales volume, what's the new roadmap for new NFT collections? What's expected by community members and collectors? Toni Thai Sterrett of Bad Grrls Creative Club, Jordan Garbis of BeetsDAO, and Eric Feng of NFT block explorer discussed with Decrypt's Kate Irwin at Camp Decrypt Napa.

entry.title: Musician 3LAU on His Music NFT Platform Royal: 'We Take Compliance Really Seriously'
entry.summary: Justin Blau aka 3LAU, CEO of Royal, talks to Decrypt's Kate Irwin about building his company around compliance from the start. "We take compliance so seriously that it might make us move a little bit slower... but we think that's really how we have to build in the space." He also said he looks to Coinbase as a model.

entry.title: FTX Meltdown 101: What the Hell Happened and What Comes Next
entry.summary: In less than a week, one of the largest and most trusted crypto exchanges went up in flames, along with its crypto celebrity founder and CEO Sam Bankman-Fried. Dan Roberts, Stacy Elliott, and Kate Irwin walk you through exactly how it happened, what it means for you, their own takes on the most interesting subplots, and what we can learn from it all. Plus: We review some comments SBF and CZ made on this podcast that look remarkable in hindsight. Watch Episode 23 of the gm podcast and make sure to subscribe on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Justin Sun On the Future of Tron's USDD Stablecoin
entry.summary: The Tron founder tells Decrypt about the network's decentralized stablecoin USDD, and how Tron aims to "bridge the Web3 world with the real world.
